Henry Ossawa Tanner

First African American painter with international acclaim

Photograph of Henry Ossawa Tanner

  • Henry Ossawa Tanner was born June 21st, 1859 in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania as the first of nine children
  • He decided to become a painter at the age of 13.
  • In 1879, he started as the only African American pupil at the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts.
  • For years, he wasn't accepted in the painting world nor in the photography world. He finally became a drawing teacher for a short time before traveling to Paris.
  • He met and studied with many artists that he maintained friendships with.
  • Throughout his developing career, he painted marine scenes, but eventually shifted his focus to religious themes.
  • In 1896, he painted The Ressurection of Lazzarus, which solidified his position in the international art world.
  • Following, he had a successful art career in Europe and the United States, finally living his life out in Paris with his wife.
